reviews.review: I played this game back In it's first release, I came back in 2017 and took a small break. Recently came back to the game and I have to say, this game is still absolutely amazing.

forgot how awesome this game is until I played it again on PC. 

Also - the DLC is really great, from shooter to survival-type, wonderful.

It has been a while since I played BioShock Infinite, but as I am here to re-install it and dive back into the floating city of Columbia I thought it was time. 

"Infinite" has been the first BioShock I have played. So it also carried the most impact for me when the story developed. Which was not quite what I expected - as I bought the game when it came out because of the wonderfully designed setting. But I was never a first-person shooter fan - not since the old days of the original Wolfenstein and Doom. 

But here I was immediately pulled into a mysterious story in a stunning setting - where immediately an ominous feeling crept onto me... this was something unique. 

I have played both "Rapture" Shocks, and I love them and I love the setting of the underwater city of Rapture. But it cannot reach the impact "Infinite" had on me. But once again, that might very well be because this is the first one I played.

I still recommend this game, even at the still pretty steep price for a game over 5 years old. As I am waiting for the installation to finish I can only say... "Bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt."

This game is my favourite in the franchise and I absolutely recommend it for the main story. However, I'm not a big fan of the gameplay of the Burial at sea DLC. Furthermore the story in episode 2 is so good that you will definitely enjoy it. 
I personally love this game because the developers put a lot of effort into creating a masterpiece that took them a long time to make similar to the first bioshock. The feeling i get playing through levels is like a canvas painting in a museum absolutely beautiful !

This game is a very fun and exciting experience. Two main characters are very appealy and dimensional. The setting is outstanding. The story is interesting and the ending is suprising. Bioshock Infinite is a great send-off to the series. It shows how fucked early America was and it is so satisfying to shoot these racist cock-heads in the head. While this game has gained criticism over the years, it's still an amazing game. This also goes for the DLC. I'm not a very emotional person when it comes to media but Bioshock Infinite's ending (the one in the dlc) is the only moment in all of the games I've played to make me tear up. Play Bioshock 1, skip 2 if you want, then play Infinite and it's DLC. It's beautiful.

probably my favorite of the bioshock games (steampunk bias).

 the gameplay is still fun but a little different from the other two games.
with the two weapon at a time limit, i find myself constantly switching weapons off the ground i find unless theres a vending machine nearby. in bioshock 1 and 2 you could carry first aid kits and eve kits but you cant carry any in infinite so you have to look for them and keep track of where they are on the map, which i personally like more. its also fun dicking around on the skylines, which actually came in handy in combat more than i thought they would.
